channel.title: Around how long does it take to learn java? Any good videos?
channel.description: How long does it take to learn java? Also anyone know any good videos that make sense to learn java?

item.source: Around how long does it take to learn java? Any good videos?

item.title: Around how long does it take to learn java? Any good videos?
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Yeah, when I first started, I thought of it as a ‘learn the easy, then medium, then hard, and woot you know it all’.
There is simply no ‘knowing it all.’
Obviously you can keep getting more complex (Hello World -> File IO -> Regex -> Reflection -> Bytecode -> Whatever else)…but thats just one ‘path.’ There is almost an endless ‘sea’ of java…it’s quite cool actually.

Read full topic
item.source: Around how long does it take to learn java? Any good videos?

item.title: Around how long does it take to learn java? Any good videos?
item.dc:creator: @Galook Galook
item.description:
@Galook wrote:

jcs_double:

to learn all of java it wuld take about a 2 year tafe/ collage course, atleast that what my it iteacher told me when i asked him it he could teach me some java

There is no “all of java,” not in two years atleast. Java isn’t only what we do here, to learn all of Java would be mastering J2ME, servlets, JDBC, and countless other topics that java is used for. Two years of nothing but Java would be nice, but you still wouldn’t know “all of java.” Java has over 2k classes in the J2SE, WAY more in the J2EE, and a bunch more in J2ME, java is just a huge amount to learn all of it. I doubt that there are many people who could make any program they need to without going and researching some(this doesnt include looking at the API, memorizing that much is just weird).

Read full topic
item.source: Around how long does it take to learn java? Any good videos?

item.title: Around how long does it take to learn java? Any good videos?
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

i wouldnt advise hello world programs. they are a waste of time

start with math sums like int x2 = 2*2; System.out.println(x2); and then gradually work your way up
